column4: hello. I have a program runned in background with & now i want to take it back in foreground. how is that possible?
in the same terminal do >>       fg        << that is all
-bash: fg: current: no such job that's what i get
as i said seems it's still runnning as i see it in ps -A and it's Time is getting more and more each time
what is the command you are using?
no what command are you chasing
what command are you trying to find - the clue must be in there
i'm trying to  find john that program
I still have not got the answer I thought i was asking for, so what exactly is the command line you were running that you put an & after
strange my thoughts are that it should have worked - as in come to the foreground  you are in the same terminal I take it
hm? my mistake ... i exited the terminal and logged back again(through ssh)
you need to run screen for that
screen is a terminal multiplexer. See http://www.kuro5hin.org/story/2004/3/9/16838/14935 and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_Screen
